column1: wide of the crease and pushed in at middle at a good length. Some drift in. Vince watchful as he taps this down the pitch
length and drifted onto the pads this time, and flicked to deep square's left
length and just outside off. Grips a shade and moves away. Soft handed forward block from Vince
full and in at leg stump again. Reaches out and whips firmly to long-on's right and there's that sharp running again
past the outside edge. Drags the length shorter this time but enough on the trajectory to still draw him forward for the block. Then rips it past the edge
length at middle stump, defended down the pitch
short of a length on the pads. No swing from that length. Bairstow comfortably on top of this to glance to fine leg
yes, James. Plants a half stride forward as Dawlat smashes this into the turf, short of a length again. Outside off this time but he pulls sweetly to the square leg fence
length just outside off, solidly defended on the front foot
misfield at mid-on. Length and slanted in at the stumps. Punched on the up to Asghar's left and he fumbles before he tumbles
short of a length on off stump, allows it to skid on and dabs to midwicket's right
length and just outside off, a bit of cut away but nothing menacing. Vince defends from inside the line
length outside off, big stride and a dead bat
short of a length and skidding into the corridor. Hurriedly chops into the covers
length on off stump, pushed to short midwicket on the front foot
length outside off, cuts away from him and he hasn't picked that. Pokes away from the body, into the off side
length on off stump, defended down the pitch
another misfield, this time at mid-off. And this time it costs them two. Length outside off and he reaches out to drill this. A slide from the fielder to his left, but this seeps through
short and wide outside off, left alone
short and just outside off, controlled pull out to deep square
short of a length just outside off, punched on the rise, back at the bowler
length on off stump, tapped on the up to mid-off
length on middle stump, nudged to mid-on off the front foot
length and dipping in at the stumps. Punched to mid-on
length and just outside off, defended on the front foot as this turns away
length outside off, defended on the front foot
gets it past mid-off. Nicely done from Bairstow,good low hands. Full outside off, allows it to land and gets his weight into this drive
length on middle stump, plants the front leg across, flicks to short fine's left
short of a length just outside off. Vince has seemingly defended for the one that comes in. This one goes away. Short enough to evade trouble though, it's defended down the pitch
length outside off, driven on the rise to mid-off

not fully in control of this pull, but hit well enough in the end. Some shape in from a good length. Gets on the front foot and gets it high on the bat. It bounces past midwicket and there's no stopping it after that
length on middle stump, mistimed punch on the up to mid-on
short of a length outside off, punched on the rise to mid-off's left

swats at this. And gets enough to beat mid-off to his right. Completely out of shape as he hits this. A bit of a walk down and he wants to go on the rise, over the bowler. It hurries him and he can't get a swing through the line. A feeble chip, it appears, but mid-off's not chasing it down
length outside off, tapped on the up to cover
in the air and safely to deep square's right. Walks into it again and drags this pull from outside off
short of a length on leg stump, poked to short fine's left
length on middle stump, defended off the back foot
short and wide outside off, left alone
withdraws from the pull as this turns away. Once again, he has not picked the variation. Shapes to pull and just ends up embarrassingly far away from this in the end
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
length on off, defended off the inside half
tossed up outside off, presses into this forward defence
length at middle stump, punched towards mid-on
chipped over the bowler. In control this time and good connection. Length at off stump, keeps the front leg out of the way and creates room to bring a straight bat from under to launch this
attempted slower bounce. Short and very wide. Left alone
misfield again. Third today, from my count. Length outside off, punched with an angled bat, straight to cover, who fails to get down in time

misjudged at deep square! Vince survives. A mistimed pull, sliced right off the low part of the bat. Hangs invitingly up for Nabi who seems to have thought this was hit harder - he runs along the perimeter rather than in. It's too late by the time he realises. The ball plonks into the turf to his left
length outside off, nudged into the off side
full on off stump, driven inside-out, along the floor to mid-off
full on leg stump, paddled to short fine and it is yet another misfield
length outside off, driven on the up to the bowler
length at off stump, on the back foot to whip this to long-on
length on off stump, blocked down the pitch
length outside off, blocked on the front foot
inside edge snapped on the bounce by a diving Alikhil to his left. Good work from the keeper, full stretch. This is short outside off and he wants to fetch it with a pull
short outside off and he nails the pull this time. Two to Nabi's left at deep square

not anymore! Vince's adventurous pulling has finally cost him. Short in the corridor, on the front foot to pull this. Looks like a top edge onto his helmet that lobs up for short fine leg. He holds his shape under it and takes it easily. Dawlat's persistence pays off. Vince's scratchy stay is over
short and wide outside off. Left alone
short of a length just outside off, allows it on and opens the face to get this towards third man
length and curving in late at off stump. Looks to punch on the up, gets it to mid-on off the inside half
length at middle stump, poked into the leg side
length on middle stump, leans in and flicks to midwicket's right
length at middle stump, defended into the leg side
length at leg stump, flicked to short fine's left
length on middle stump, pushed down the pitch
length on leg stump, flicked to midwicket
length on middle stump, defended on the front foot
full on off, steps across and flicks to short midwicket
whack. Full outside off, steps into the the line, swings across it and clears midwicket with a slog sweep. No one back at the boundary there
length at off stump, closes the face too early on this, gets a leading edge into the off side
full outside off, leans in and drives to long-on
length on middle stump, shuffles and flicks to deep square
short and wide outside off, waits late, allows it to turn in and caresses this to the point boundary with a cut
length ball, legcutter, lobbed right up outside off at 99kph. Left alone
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
thick edge down to third man. Length ball wide outside off and a bit of a casual heave at this, away from the body
inside edge past off stump. Goes away from the body, stabbing at this short of a length ball with an angled bat. Didn't quite come on
length at off stump, punched back to the bowler on the up
length outside off, shuffles and jabs in midwicket's direction
beats the outside edge. The perfect legbreak to start. Drift, dip, and a good length outside off drawing Bairstow in before getting it to jump past the edge
length outside off, stabbed through cover with hard hands
short of a length just outside off, gets on the back foot and taps into the covers
short of a length outside off, punched to sweeper cover
pumped straight! Full and flat just outside off. Bairstow to the pitch quickly, helped by the flatter trajectory too, and a nice, sweet hit - about 85 metres
short of a length just outside off, pushed into the covers off the back foot
full on middle stump, leans in and drives to long-on with the turn
short of a length just outside off, backs away and punches to long-on off the back foot
length on middle stump, shuffles and flicks to deep square
short of a length just outside off, backs away and checks the punch. Rolls into the off side
short of a length and getting big on him as he shapes to flick. Out to short fine
length at leg stump, flicked to short fine
short of a length at middle stump, punched to midwicket on the up
length on middle stump, punched to long-on
length on leg stump, flicked to deep square
full slower ball at off stump, jammed down the pitch to the bowler
length outside off, leans in and fends to point on the front foot
outside edge safely down to third man. Another waft away from the body at a length ball
tossed up outside off, driven with the turn to long-off
nicely placed. Tossed up outside off and Root doesn't even allow this to land. Gets low and sweeps to the vacant midwicket boundary. Low risk, high reward
length at middle stump, on the back foot to expertly punch this in front of deep midwicket for the the second
short and wide outside off, lots of turn, but cut to sweeper's left with ease
length outside off, leans in and drives to sweeper with the turn
short of a length just outside off, chopped to sweeper's left
overpitched just outside off, driven back to the bowler

get out of the way! England have worked out Gulbadin and Rahmat are Afghanistan's part-time options today and they will no longer let them sneak these cheap overs in. Full on off, drills it past the bowler's face with a straight bat
full outside off, driven to extra cover on the front foot
length outside off, opens the face and runs it down to third man
length on leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket
length just outside off, looks to run it down to third man, can't get it past point
pushed through, Root through the shot and it loops up towards short fine leg... Not the most secure start
fizzes down the legbreak a touch wide, Root goes back and picks a gap through cover for a couple this time
patted towards backward point
steps down and drives one through mid-on
flighted, YJB reaches for the drive and skews it in front of backward point, in the air and Rashid threw his hands up... but didn't go to hand and they pinch a couple
tossed up and worked into a gap
touch back of a length, clipped off the hip, bit of inside edge for a single
steps across and works towards midwicket
jabbed down towards backward point, misfielded by Najibullah Zadran as he goes to collect and throw... England raise their century
fuller, tailing in and clipped to long-on
length ball on the stumps, Root punches down the ground
pitched up and stroked through extra cover, beats mid-off's dive... Fifty for Bairstow, his slowest in ODIs. But England will be grateful for another solid start
floated up and stroked on the front foot into a gap for a couple
jabbed towards cover from the crease
pushes through the legbreak, Root is on the back foot and dabs this squarer for one
floated up on middle and leg, worked across the line
quick and flat outside off, not much turn and YJB steers it to backward point
tossed up a touch slower, around off stump and met watchfully on the front foot. Smiles exchanged between the two SRH team-mates
short of a length, 121kph/75mph around off stump, defended
punched back towards the bowler, Gulbadin sticks out a paw but can't prevent a run
back of a length, turned down towards midwicket but Rahmat is quickly in
no room to free the arm, tapped to the leg side again
skidding on, Bairstow brings the bottom hand through and punches this past midwicket, long-on has to run around and they come back for two
full and inviting the drive, YJB spanks it to extra cover
deftly placed off the back foot, out towards deep backward point, excellent bit of fielding from Noor Ali Zadran - saves Afghanistan a run
tossed up and punched to mid-off
bit of loop, straighter line and YJB drops back and stabs through mid-on
angling in, worked around the front pad to midwiwicket
uses the feet and clips down the ground to long-on
darted on middle and leg, YJB dabs one more past the bowler
shout of 'how was that?' from Rashid, as Bairstow pokes at the googly, just got some bat on it, I think
floated into the arc, YJB releases the handbrake and creams this through mdiwicket for four! Nailed on the slog-sweep
quicker, straightening on the stumps, just takes the edge and flies wide of slip! Gripped enough as YJB poked at it
full and swung away, sweetly lofted into the crowd at cow! YJB hitting his way out of trouble, clearing that front leg as soon as Rashid lobs it up
flatter and jabbed through mid-on off the back foot
driven through mid-off
clipped off the pads, Mujeeb runs up from short fine leg... and then slips over, missing the ball and allowing a single
floated up and stroked down the ground
round the wicket, darted on the stumps and Root punches back to the bowler
pushed a touch wider and Root steers it away square on the off side
drops short, wheeled away through square, beats the man on the rope for four! Muscular pull from YJB and it zips away
flighted, tapped back down the track
pushed through and driven down the ground coming forwards
flighted, spinning a touch, tapped back
quick outside off, Bairstow presses out and defends
very full, right up on the crease... but YJB marmalises a drive off the back foot, powered towards deep extra cover and Dawlat can't reel it in on the rope!
floated up on off, blocked on the front foot
full on middle and leg, driven crisply down the ground but Mujeeb does well to cut this off and keep them to one
lobbed up and pushed back down the pitch
goes for the sweep off the pads, overbalances but the ball scuttles fine
flighted, outside leg stump and Root sweeps neatly for one
boshed! Smeared straight back down the ground, YJB making an early move and freeing the arms to bludgeoning effect!
tighter lines and worked off the pads
pushed across from round the wicket, goes back to dab through cover point
short outside off, runs this down to third man
back of a length, tucked to square leg from back in the crease
fullish length, 120kph/74mph and pushed gently back towards the bowler reaching forwards
shortish and worked off the hip behind square
back of a length, 74mph outside off and Root gets up on his tip-toes to find the cover sweeper
length on the pads and worked to midwicket
floated up and pushed back, the ball ends up with midwicket
on the stumps, maybe the carrom ball and Root steps out, dabs down the ground
floated full on leg stump, clipped square
comes forward and drills this to long-on
lobbed up and tapped back to the bowler
angling in and worked off the front pad, gets this into a gap for a couple
short of a length outside off, steered through point
cutter from Gulbadin, jabbed towards mid-on and Root doesn't respond quickly enough to the call, YJB having to return to his ground
fullish on middle and off, worked off the pads to midwicket
back of a length on off stump, clipped to extra cover

got him! Chipped back to the bowler! Gulbadin brings out the gunshow, and it's a timely breakthrough for his side... No hundred for Bairstow, never mind doubling it; pace off the ball and he just punched it off bottom part of the bat, well taken by the bowler diving to his left
round the wicket, good length in the channel, 124kph/77mph and left alone
goes back and across and swipes through cover
angled in from round the wicket, Morgan stays back and tucks to midwicket
flighted, bit of spin and Morgan pushes forward, comes off the outer half of the bat
floated full and a touch wider, left alone this time
flat offbreak, Morgan jabs it from the crease, beats mid-off for his first run
touch wide and Root is deep in the crease and sliding this into a gap behind point for a couple more

dropped into the off side, Morgan sets off and has to turn back as the fielder hares in... and Gulbadin then puts an arm around Morgan, having given chase in his follow through - possibly to prevent a collision, though Morgan dropped his bat reaching for his ground. Smiles between the captains, though
tapped into the off side, but Gulbadin has overstepped
ugh, that is a bad ball, Morgan waits for the long-hop to reach him and cracks it over deep midwicket! So short it had pretty much stopped by the time it got to him, loopy and spankable
goes down the ground this time! Full and slotted high over long-on! Morgan goes BOOM-BOOM
better length, worked off the pads
short outside off, Root drops deep and picks out backward point
back of a length, pulled for a single
flicked off the pads, Morgan is alert to a quick single - and that's a half-century for Root, continuing his prolific tournament
lobbed up outside off, Morgan reverse-chips over short third man! Insouciant from England's captain, played to perfection, too
presses out and defends
darted in, flicked off the legs but short fine leg is there
tossed up and pushed into the covers
floated up, Morgan miscues this down the ground, on the bounce to long-off
floated up from over the wicket, Morgan punches through mid-off
quicker on middle and leg, Root sweeps through backward square
bit of dip and spin, Morgan defends on middle and off
flighted, defended coming forwards
googly from Rashid, sliding across outside off, Morgan cuts behind square for a couple
chopped through the infield and again they come back for two, well chased down in the deep
full on off, 136kph/84mph, driven firmly but straight to mid-off
length, nips in a touch and clips the inside edge, rolls harmlessly down the pitch
edged but bounces short of the keeper! It was a cutter from Dawlat, nicked attempting to dab off the back foot, but Ikram was still too far back to be in contention for a catch
bit of width and this is steered wide of third man, just a single despite pushing on the first
dug in short, Root yells 'yeah!' as deep midwicket has to run around, scurries back for the second
low full toss, 134kph/83mph and Root mistimes it to midwicket
pushes through a googly, Morgan chops it through point going back - raises the England 200

dropped! Morgan goes for the slog-sweep, this has gone high towards deep midwicket... but Dawlat has misjudged this and it goes over his head! Barely got a hand on it. Bounces for four, too, much to Rashid's disgust
swung for six this time! No chance for Dawlat to make up for his error! Morgan nails it, going to the same part of the ground
pushes through and chopped off the bottom edge
fizzed on off stump, tapped back
dragged down, belted into the crowd again! Second six of the over for Morgan, who isn't going to miss out on those, short and leg side and panned!
length outside off, punched to sweeper
offcutter at a length on middle stump, backs away and tries to run it down. It gets big on him and raps his thumb as it deflects wide of the keeper
full toss on leg stump, flicked to fine leg's left
short and wide, sitting up nicely outside off. Root gets off the ground, stays underneath the ball and chops it over point
short of a length and just outside off, looks to pull, sliced to deep square's left
length on leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket
length and just outside off, sliced straight to short third
length outside off, driven on the rise to sweeper's left
length and in at middle stump, nudged hurriedly to midwicket
length on off stump, swept to deep square's left
length outside off, looks to back and punch. Through it too early and gets it off the under-edge into the off side
length on middle, flicked to midwicket's left
pummels his fifth six over midwicket to bring up his fifty! This is a woeful ball - dropped short and coming in at Morgan who quickly jumps into position and swings clean
short of a length just outside off, chopped to point
length outside off, leans in and chips to sweeper's left
length at middle stump, gets low and plays the reverse-sweep. Straight to sweeper
length on middle stump, punched to long-on with the angle
length on leg stump, flicked to short fine
six number six! Just clears the midwicket fence this time. Length at middle and he gets low, right under it as he swipes across the line. ODI six number 200 as well, I'm informed
length outside off, stabbed into the off side off the front foot
nicely placed! Full googly outside off, uses its pace and rolls his wrists on the sweep to find the gap to deep square's left
length ball, quicker one, angled down leg side. Looks to flick but can't get bat on it. Keeper deflects to short fine's left
length on middle stump, defended off the back foot
full on off stump, jabbed back into the off side
length outside off, driven to mid-off's right
short of a length outside off, chopped straight to point
straight over the bowler! Whew! 91 metres from Morgan. Fired in at a length from around the wicket and it's as good as giving him throwdowns. So much width and he clubs through the line, on the rise
and now it's short. Morgan getting them to bowl where he wants them to bowl. Sits back for another mighty pull, a six over midwicket once again
length at middle stump, driven down the ground
length at middle stump, swept to deep square
yorker length at off stump, jammed into the pitch
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper cover
falls short of short third. Full outside off and he whips out a reverse sweep that loops in front of the diving Asghar
length at off stump, steps out and chips on the rise to sweeper's right
length outside off, tapped into the covers on the up
length just outside off, chopped to short third
beaten. Top over from Afghanistan's best bowler on the day. Short of a length and jumping up at Morgan as he looks to run this past the keeper
length on leg stump, looks to sweep, gets it over the keeper off the glove
clears the front leg, clears the boundary! Once again, might as well be throwing them down in the nets now. Quick, straight, overpitched at leg stump. Makes room and drills it in long-on's direction
short and wide outside off, backs away and cuts to sweeper's left
number 10! Short at middle stump, gets deep and pumps it over deep square with a pull!
length outside off, nudged into the covers

the fourth-fastest World Cup century! What a brute of an innings by Eoin Morgan. Unbelievable hitting. He's taken on everyone, including a man considered the best legspinner when it comes to white-ball cricket. Sends him over long-on again, clearing the front leg.
deft. Slower, short of a length at leg stump. Shuffles into the leg side and ramps this past short fine
yorker at middle stump, jammed out to long-on
slower ball, short of a length outside off. Waits for it to come on and wants to spank it wide of mid-off. But he finds that fielder on the bounce
yorker at leg stump, mistimed drive down to long-on brings up the 300
full and just outside off, opens up his stance and mistimes this carve over mid-off
I'll have some of that says Root as he runs down the pitch, possibly premeditatedly. He's not to the pitch but he goes through and slugs this length ball over long-on
full and wide outside off, driven to extra cover's right
short and wide outside off, beaten on the cut
full on middle stump, gets the stride out and nails the slog sweep. Gets it over deep square. Rashid doesn't know where to go now
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper's right
clears long-off. This is just...obscene. Googly, wide outside off. So much room. So much Morgan - drilled again
slower ball at a length, down leg side. Beaten on the attempted sweep
full and just outside off, keeps his shape and chips this wide of mid-off
slower short ball at middle stump, pulled to deep square

looks like a other! Length ball pushed across him. He makes room and checks his shot a touch after reaching out for it. Mid-off is in. This lands on the padding at the long-off boundary. He has 14 sixes
slower short ball, wide outside off. Reaches out ad cuts uppishly to the extra cover boundary
full and just outside off, driven uppishly to long-off
attempted reverse ramp. He's beaten. Slower ball, dug in short of a length and rising over off stump
straight. You know it! Eoin Morgan gets one more in his hitting zone. He clears the front leg and slams it flat to long-off's left

equals the most number of sixes hit in an ODI innings! No. 16 for Morgan. Slower ball at a length outside off. So much time as he waits on it to arrive. He's set up for a slog and he sends it over wide long-on
yorker at middle stump, jammed to long-on's left

finds long-on. Slower ball, full outside off. In the slot for the big launch over long-on. Not quite the thing Root does best. It's flat and to the fielder out there. A top ODI knock. Another top ODI knock.
ODI world record for sixes! A century in sixes for Morgan! 17! 102 runs with 17 shots. Full and just outside off, clears the front leg and pumps it into the boundary padding behind the bowler

finds long-off. Whew. What have we just witnessed? Morgan's all smiles as he walks off. I'm sure not even he knows what has just transpired. Slower ball, short and outside off. Flat-bats it and is taken well inside the line
length ball pushed wide outside off, has shaped early for the ramp but that keeps going wide of him and eventually has him on the floor as he misses
short at middle stump, pulled to deep square
yorker at middle stump, nicely executed. He can't get this sloq away. Rolls out to deep midwicket off the inside edge

taken at mid-off. Well they've figured out that slowers balls at the way to go. Three in a row with it. Short of a length outside off. Sets up for the pull but is cramped and slices it weakly for Nabi
short of a length just outside off, chopped straight to point
slower ball at a length, down leg side. Can't connect on the flick
short of a length just outside off, mistimed punch to mid-off
boom. Welcome back Rashid. Googly, tossed up outside off. Moeen gets the stride in and sends it flying over long-off
short of a length outside off, hurriedly scythes this to long-off

stumping appeal as Stokes is beaten. Googly, short of a length outside off. Loses his balance and drags the back leg out as he looks to drive through the off side. Seems to have just managed to get something behind the line, reckons the umpire. Not out.
dropped. Short and wide outside off. Looks to cut and the keeper puts it down
length at middle stump, swept out to deep square

and Moeen slugs over wide long-on to tip Rashid well into the pit. The most runs EVER conceded in a World Cup match. Length at middle stump, clears the front leg and swings like there's nothing to lose. Because there really isn't
smashes leg stump. Stokes steps into the off side and wants to flick this yorker, but he's missed and he's shown too much of the stumps as well
slower short ball at off stump, pulls onto his body off the inside edge but they sneak a run pitch side
top edge safely past the backtracking keeper and then skids into the boundary. Good bouncer, has him cramped on the hook, but in case you didn't get the memo - this is a day for runs
bouncer. Too short and down leg side. Left alone

smoked over square leg! Gosh! Exactly the shots coaches train out of toddlers - front leg facing square leg, back leg rooted, head in the leg side, ball on the off. But those hands...phew. Clean swing as this slower ball rises up for him and he nails the connection
drilled over wide long-on! Oh boy. 25th six. Most in an innings, ever, beating England's own record. Length ball on leg stump, gets the front leg out of the way and sends it sailing
boooooooooo it's only 397. Dawlat goes around, the killjoy, and bowls a good yorker outside off. Moeen can only drive respectfully to sweeper cover
shortish outside off, tapped down moving across
good nut, seams in and clears the stumps! Noor Ali late trying to get his bat down, but survives
slings this down the leg side
fired in on off stump, 136kph/84mph and blocked
touch fuller and blocked solidly on the front foot
tight stuff from Woakes, whirring in on off stump, Noor Ali jabs down in defence
hits the pads, but probably heading leg side... Stifled appeal as Noor Ali misses flicking across the line
pitched up, 144kph/89mph and Gulbadin gets forward, times this nicely back down the ground... Woakes does superbly well to give chase and flick it back just in front of long-off!

dragged on! First one down! Archer pitches this up outside off, 145kph/90mph and Noor Ali thrashes a leaden-footed drive, only succeeds in getting an inside edge into middle stump. No sign of the bails staying put this time
length ball, good pace on middle and off, Rahmat shows it a straight bat
speared in full, snaking towards the base of off stump, drops the bat in time
back of a length, 143kph/88mph and this takes off, roaring through as Rahmat belatedly drops his hands
good length, whistling through in the channel
length ball outside off, prodded into the covers
length around off stump and defended
outside off, 128kph/80mph an Rahmat drops it down into the off side, they scamper through
fired in on middle and leg, tucked towards midwicket
goes for the slog to cow, fullish length at 134kph/83mph and Gulbadin miscues it into his boot
lovely line, just shaping away a fraction as Gulbadin hangs deep and dangles the bat
comes across on off stump and taps down
climbing from a length, rapid in the channel outside off, thudding into the keeper's gloves almost as Rahmat made the decision to leave
presses out and cushions this into the covers for one
short and pulled off the hip, shovelled away behind square for a couple as fine leg runs up
shortish, 140kph/87mph and coming in to be blocked on off stump
short and a touch leg side, Gulbadin pulls and misses
short and offering width for Rahmat, who crunches through point for Afghanistan's first boundary
better line, tight around off and defended

dropped! Draws the outside edge, straight to first slip, but Bairstow shells it! Through the hands, rebounded off the chest and Root was then unable to grab it diving from second... Rahmat gets a life!
lines this one up in defence
stays back and pokes this down into the covers
good length ball around off stump, defended watchfully
heaved away into the leg side, Gulbadin connects with one
crunched over cow corner! Six out of the middle of the bat! That's as clean a hit as we've seen today (which is genuinely saying something)
full on off, slugged down the ground! Continues to treat Archer's pace dismissively, three boundaries in a row for the Afghanistan captain!
short ball, 138kph/86mph and swung away to fine leg for one
banged in, climbing through to the keeper as Rahmat ducks and weaves
lifter to finish, straightening a touch outside off, beats the crease-bound prod
slower ball, pitched up on the stumps and Gulbadin closes the face, manages to divert a leading edge through extra cover for a couple
pace off again, down the leg side as Gulbadin comes across and has a swish
length on off, tapped down into the covers for a jogged single
back of a length, Rahmat moves into line and pushes to cover
fuller, 137kph/85mph and punched to mid-off
fullish, steered behind backward point
pace off again, cutter outside off and Gulbadin gets a thickish edge down to third man
short of a length and tucked off the hip
good pace in the channel outside off, flash and a miss from Rahmat
back of a length, zipping through as the batsman thinks about pulling and then leaves
pitched up, 140kph/87mph and punched from off stump towards mid-on
length ball around off, defended
pitched up and driven smoothly but picks out mid-off
slower ball, flicked off the body to short fine leg
short and leg side, helped away with a flick of the bat through backward square leg, into a gap and that'll be four
tight on off stump, blocked
short outside off, 134kph/82mph and whacked over point, second four in the over for Gulbadin! Room to free the arm, he continues his one-man assault
comes across and taps this one down
shuffle into line and slices one down to third man
back of a length over the stumps, Gulbadin aims another slog to leg and misses this time
full, 144kph/89mph and a big swipe comes off the inside edge into the pads, the ball stops dead on the leg side and they steal the single as Archer follows up
digs in the bumper, Rahmat ducks it. Just a casual strike rate of 26, at the moment, for the Test captain
back of a length in the channel, again left alone
short of a length, 139kph/86mph over off stump, defended up on his toes
short ball, gracefully pulled through midwicket, though not quite timed - three into the deep takes Rahmat into double-figures
lobbed up as Rahmat comes down, this turns and hits the pads before deflecting into the leg side
steps out and pushes a single through mid-on
pushed through, Gulbadin steps out and taps it away
spinning in on, the stumps, worked towards midwicket
works this with the turn through square leg for a single
dragged down a touch, Rahmat waits and clips off his hip through square once more
full, tailing in at 141kph/88mph and timed nicely on the drive, straight to mid-on
presses on to the front foot and blocks
pitched up, 138kph/86mph and met with a straight bat into the covers
touch shorter and straighter, flicked through midwicket

dug in, Gulbadin top-edges a pull... and Buttler takes an excellent running catch! Short and cramped for room, 147kph/92mph and looping up as the captain continued to attack, the ball ended up somewhere near short fine leg but Buttler snared it safely diving full length to give Wood a wicket in his opening over!
back of a length, touching 90mph once again, worked through midwicket... they think better of trying for two
tossed up, spinning in from outside off, Rahmat drops back and punches for one
round the wicket, angled in and straightening a touch, Hasmatullah leans out to defend
pushed in and flicked to the leg side
Rahmat stays back and works this through square leg
floated up full and Hashmat taps towards mid-on
drops back in the crease and slices this through backward point
speared across on a length, Hashmat defends pressing out
tempting length, 142kph/87mph outside off, lets this one go
finds the edge, but this flies between slip and gully! Third man won't cut it off, either
dug in, high bouncer and Hashmat isn't interested in taking it on
woof, that's a spicy meatball... climbing from a length, 145kph/90mph and past the outside edge!
pitched up, 147kph/91mph and straightening a fraction, Hashmat defends cautiously
length, swerving across the left-hander, keeps his bat inside the line
goes back outside off and dabs one through cover point
floated up on middle and leg, Hashmat clips through mid-on
fuller on middle stump, driven but intercepted on the dive by midwicket
presses out and cushions into the covers, Rahmat sets off but is sent back, Buttler throws to the wrong end... Rahmat was struggling if he had turned to shy at the striker's stumps!
lobbed up and dabbed safely into a gap this time
round the wicket, pushed through and steered square from the crease
slams in the bumper, 146kph/90mph and Hashmat is quick to duck out of the way
shortish, up to 92mph, defended on the back foot
tight around off stump, blocked towards mid-off and Hashmat charges down before yelling 'wait, wait, wait!' Moeen doesn't collect cleanly, though
jumps wide and spears the ball full, defended
back of a length in the corridor, steered towards gully
another bouncer to finish, zipping through as the batsman crouches
floated up and stroked through the off side
Hashmat comes out to drive, Moeen cuts it off diving to his right
flighted, around off stump, pushed down the ground
have summa that, says Rahmat! Dances out and skelps a lofted drive straight back over long-off! Very nicely played
uses the feet again, driven along the carpet to long-on this time
tossed up and punched back past the bowler
length and pinging him on the thigh as he shapes to flick this. High on the lbw
bouncer at a middle stump line. Nicely directed. Has him cramped and swishing underneath it
length at off stump, looks to stab this into the off side, gets it to midwicket off the inside edge
length outside off, square drive on the rise to sweeper's right
short and slanted across the corridor. Hangs the bat out and is beaten
bouncer across the corridor again. Ducks inside the line and lets this go
length at off stump, gets deep to try and flick. Cops it on the thigh again. Some turn there for Moeen
short and skidding outside off. Backs away and wafts at this. Outside edge but there's no slip, oddly
length at off stump, shuffles and flicks to midwicket
full on middle stump, steps out and drives to long-on
length at middle stump, defended on the front foot
length and in at middle stump, hurriedly defended off the back foot
short of a length just outside off, chopped down to third man
length at middle stump, defended into the leg side off the back foot
short and across off stump. Slashes and is beaten
full on middle stump, driven to mid-on's left
length at the stumps, blocked from the crease
short of a length just outside off, opens the face and runs this down to third man
length on the stumps, whipped to deep square
length at off stump, driven with the turn to long-off
length at leg stump, allows it to skid down leg and tickles it past short fine
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper cover
past the outside edge. Grip from a length outside off and sharp turn as Shahidi's feet are rooted for this attempted punch
full on off stump, driven to sweeper cover
bouncer dug in very short. Ducks under that
short of a length at off stump, defended into the off side
short of a length just outside off, sliced to third man
length outside off, driven on the rise to sweeper cover
full at middle stump, jammed to mid-on off the front foot
length and in at leg stump, tickled down to fine leg with the angle
length at the stumps, flicked into the leg side
short of a length outside off, tapped into the covers off the back foot
length at middle, flicked to midwicket
yorker length at off stump, jabbed out to mid-off
length at middle stump, flicked with soft hands to deep midwicket's right
length outside off, steps out and drives back to the bowler
short of a length just outside off, sliced to point on the rise
length outside off, driven on the up to sweeper cover
short of a length and in at off stump. Inside edge into the pitch, rolls out to the keeper
short of a length in the corridor, looks to run it down and under-edges towards the keeper again
short ball just outside off, sways out of the line and lets this go
length outside off, opens the face and gets it down to third man
full at middle stump, trickles through square leg as he flicks off the inside edge
full on off stump, flowing drive straight to mid-off
length outside off, stabbed to extra cover's right off the front foot
length at off stump, blocked on the front foot

finds deep midwicket with possibly the easiest ball he's faced today. Dirty tossed up full toss just outside off. He's looked to club this over the leg side boundaries and managed to get it off the inside part of that bat to find that fielder
googly raps the pad as he gets deep in the crease for a leg glance. Going down
full on middle stump, driven to mid-on
length on middle stump, defended off the back foot
bouncer at a middle stump line, ducks and lets it go. Good leaving technique, the bat was right down
length outside off, sliced wide of third man
length on middle stump, defended into the leg side
short of a length just outside off, defended off the back foot
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper cover
full on off stump, driven with the turn to long-off
short of a length at off stump, on the back foot to nudge this into the square leg region
short of a length just outside off, mistimed punch to extra cover
length at off stump, defended off the inside half
rips past the bat. Lands this on a length, off stump, and squares him up on the back foot
short of a length just outside off, runs it down to third man with an angled bat
short ball jumps up at an off stump line. Surprises him. Leaps up and defends into the pitch
short of a length just outside off, opens the face and runs it to point's right
length outside off, driven on the rise to extra cover
short of a length at off stump, defended hurriedly off the back foot
length outside off, defended to point off the back foot
length ball outside off, and turning way. Fended off the back foot to the off side
extra flight, full and wide outside of. Hammered off the front foot, but can't beat mid off
another full ball, tossed up on middle, but this time the batsman skips down the ground and muscles a leg-side loft over long on! Massive
full and wide outside off. Driven against the turn to sweeper-cover
full, on off, and muscled over cover. Sliced, really, but lands safe
flatter, on middle and skidding through. Tries to pull, but it's been inside-edged to the fine-leg boundary
length at middle stump, tickled into the leg side and quickly sprints across, slides and picks up on the turnabout before smashing the stumps down at the striker's end. Athlete Wood
length outside off, looks to drive, thick outside edge down to third man
no idea where the ball is. Sharp bouncer in the corridor and Asghar just leaps with his eyes closed and the bat swaying in hope. It falls into the pitch in the end
short outside off, hurried pull to mid-on's right

straight into the helmet. That is a mean connection. Root at slip has his hands on his head. That sounded nasty. Short and in the corridor. He takes his eyes off it and gets it smack on the back of his head. He's currently on the floor..back on his feet. Gentle applause from the crowd. Medical staff from both camps are tending to him, it appears. He looks disoriented...and so does the bowler, actually. He's waiting for a new helmet to arrive, says Sharda from the ground. Good signs so far...although immediate signs are not always accurate signs with such injuries. He's got a new helmet on. He will bat. Off go the doctors.
143 kph short ball follows. At his chest. Leaps up and dabs it down to fine leg
full on middle stump, flicked to midwicket with the turn
past the outside edge. Length outside off, leans in and stabs inside the line of this regular legbreak
full on middle stump, swept to deep backward square
length on middle stump, hard hands on the forward block down the pitch
googly, back of a length and in at middle. Pushed to mid-on off the back foot
length on middle stump, defended on the front foot
short of a length, 147kph, jumps into the leg side and clips this off his hip to the fine leg boundary
falls short of fine leg. Once again he's jumping into the off side against the short ball. Awkward ramp up as he's in the air. It doesn't carry
yorker at middle stump, jammed past the non-striker to steal a single
full on leg stump, flicked to deep square
smacks him over the long-on boundary! Short ball, what? This is pushed across him and he reaches out and swishes across the angle to clear the boundary on the leg side
bouncer across off stump, keeps his eyes on it and ducks
tossed up very wide outside off. Asghar looks to sweep and misses. Also ends up performing circles on the floor to ensure he's in the crease
length at middle stump, defended into the leg side
pumps him over the midwicket boundary!Length on leg stump, steps out and goes against the turn for sweet success
short of a length just outside off, defended into the off side
full on off stump, driven to mid-off
where are your boundary fielders? asks Shahidi as he gets to the pitch and unleashes a gorgeous looking drive against the turn. Just clears the long-off boundary
short of a length, 136kph/84mph and driven square off the back foot, placed for a couple
dug in, over the stumps and defended, square on but solidly in behind the ball
banged in short and this is cracked past mid-on! Whiplash pull from Asghar and it faces away!
genuine bumper, 88mph and this climbs over the top edge as he attempts to pull again and is beaten
back of a length outside off, dabbles with a horizontal bat and again fails to connect
dropped! Steepler towards fine leg, but Bairstow can't cling on once again! He made the ground but the ball burst through his fingertips, granting a life for Asghar
dip and spin, past the attempted sweep... and Buttler whips off the bails! They are going to check, although Asghar doesn't look like he'a worried at all. Yep, back foot never left the ground
touch short and straightening on leg, swatted away behind square for one
pushed across from over the wicket, Hashmat dabs it through backward point and the sweeper has to run around
flighted, spinning down the leg side where Buttler can't collect
lobbed up on leg stump and swept hard and flat for one
pushed through and steered into the off side
floated full and again he gets the sweep away, played this deftly behind square and it will run away - that's a half-century for Hashmatullah, who has recovered well from that prang on the bonce!
more chin music from Archer, 145kph/90mph and Asghar pulls in the air, bounces safely as deep square leg runs around
length on the stumps, tucked into the leg side towards midwicket
beats the outside edge, slanted across at 89mph, nipping through to the keeper
dug in as Hashmat backs off and waves his bat... too high
back of a length on off stump, dabbed towards backward point
short on the hip and all he has to do is tickle this for four past the keeper
pushed across and steered towards point from the crease
tossed up and prodded away on off stump
nicely played, gets well forward to sweep and clouts the ball hard to deep backward square leg
drags this down a touch, spins away and prodded down from the crease
legbreak on middle and off, pushed into the covers
short and leg side, Asghar wheels around and slaps to fine leg for one
floated up, Hashmat goes back in the crease and taps the ball to square leg
slightly back of a length outside off, Asghar swipes at it and misses
cutter into the pitch, pulled through midwicket for a single
pitched up on off stump, driven wide of mid-off and they scamper through
short of a length on the hip, worked away through square leg
hits a length around off stump, blocked into the off side
pitched up and Hashmat has a swipe, miscued towards midwicket
backs away outside leg, Rashid follows him and spins the ball out of the rough, hits inside edge and then pad
on the stumps and worked through square leg
flighted, Hashmat steps out and punches to cover
lobbed up nice and full, this time he reverse-sweeps and gets a few more into the deep, YJB cutting it off on the rope at deep backward point
floats this on leg stump, paddled fine for a couple more
loopy full toss this time, Hashmat sweeps again and pops uppishly into the leg side
angled across and pushed into the covers
touch short, Hashmat steps down and then chops towards backward point
in the channel, maybe a touch of pace off, swing and a miss from Hashmat
full and swatted away through square leg
short ball, 129kph/80mph up around the armpit, Asghar clubs it down to fine leg
steered away square from the crease, Vince does well to cut it out on the dive and prevent a run, too
floated up and swept behind square with a full extension of the arms
shuffles across in premeditated fashion and laps towards short fine leg
tucks this one to the leg side
uses the feet and chips this in the air... doesn't quite carry to long-off running in!

turn, off the face, gobbled up at slip! Another for Rashid and Asghar falls short of a fighting fifty... Root did well to make that catch look so routine, as Buttler made a move towards it with his gloves as the ball zipped through
tossed up, nice and juicy... and Nabi creams his first ball over long-on! Right out of the screws, what a way to get going!
goes back and across and glides this behind square
short ball, Nabi goes to pull and gets a top edge into his body, lands safely a couple of feet behind him
dug in and this is pulled safely for one behind square on the leg side
pushed back down the track, Woakes leaps across to his right, panther-like to stop it
back of a length, plinked into the off side, did that carry to mid-off...? No, I don't think Wood quite got his hand under the ball, decent effort, though
short ball outside off, comes off the toe of the bat down to third man as Nabi pulls
tossed up and driven down the ground coming forwards
big spin, this rags past the flailing bat, but not gathered cleanly by Buttler

smashed belligerently into the sky, taken safely in the deep this time! Nabi got under another Hail Mary, went a long way up but Stokes was ready and waiting when it plummeted back to earth, walking in from long-on to pouch it safely
flighted, dabbed behind square

pushes through the googly, reverse-sweep from Najib and Buttler claims the catch! Not given by Joel Wilson but England review, though replays suggest it's an optimistic one. Najibullah almost caught up with the ball on its way through, but no cigar. And England lose their review
shortish, popped up into the leg aside, Woakes can't get there in his follow through
back of a length, swing and a miss from Najib
pace off, the ball sits up... and Najib hammers this over deep midwicket! A real baseball swing, Babe Ruthed over the ropes for the 33rd maximum of the match!
short and wide and he has to reach to get the toe end on this
pitched up on leg stump, 136kph/84mph and nudged behind square, just a single despite the early call
full and wide of the stumps, swatted through the covers
pitched up, slower ball on leg stump, clipped for one
fullish, whipped off the toes by the diminutive Hashmat
full, 143kph/89mph on leg stump, glanced behind square
length in the channel, pace off the ball again, sliced down to third man
back of a length, 140kph/87mph and Najib dabs it down through gully for one more
dug in short, Hashmat ducks it
pitched up, slower delivery and Najib slugs it down the ground, on the bounce to long-on
another variation, knuckle ball floated on leg stump, swung away through midwicket
round the wicket, pace off again, whipped to deep square
full and fast, 89mph but Hashmat simply clears the front leg and smacks four to long-on! Stand and deliver, even with a man back

bowled 'im! No World Cup hundred for Hashmat! Done by the slower ball, moving across and attempting something cute, by the time he realised the ball was arriving late he was in no position to hit it... Superb knock from Afghanistan's No. 4, though. Kept his team above water
over the wicket, bunted back to the bowler
short ball, over the top of Najib's cross-batted swipe
timber, another slowie does it! Cutter on leg stump and Najibullah misses with a heave across the line, Wood disturbs the woodwork

banged in, evasive action from Alikhil and it crashes into the glove - but Buttler can't cling on one-handed! It was tantalisingly out of reach as the keeper flung himself to his left. Would have been a brilliant take
slower ball outside off, swing and a miss
banged in at 143kph/89mph, Rashid ducks and hurls the bat in the same motion, fails to connect
full and wide, pace off this time and another wild swing misses
round the wicket, dug in and defended on the back foot, maybe another slower delivery
full outside off, 146kph/90mph and sliced off the outside edge towards third man
short ball in the channel, Rashid hacks and gets a bottom edge
fuller, hoyed over cover, clears the man running back for a couple into the deep
dug in short, too high
full toss, mistimed towards mid-off as Rashid backs away and swings hard
short ball, very slow and loopy and this time he can only connect with the toe of the bat
fired in full and straight at 145kph/90mph, neatly played off his toes
dug out to the on side, Wood flings himself after it in his follow through, but can't prevent one
short outside off, cranking up the pace, again Rashid fails to connect with a swipe
back of a length, slower ball and this time Rashid smacks it past mid-off, gets fingertips on it but won't prevent four
smashed h-i-i-i-i-i-i-i-i-i-i-g-h into the off side, won't quite go all the way towards long-off... in fact, won't even go for four!
shortish, swings hard and misses
angling in from round the wicket, tapped back
full toss on the stumps, blocked back to the bowler
fired in full on leg stump, deflected behind square for one

short ball, slapped high towards the cover boundary... Bairstow holds this one! He turns to the crowd and grins, Archer has another wicket, Rashid Khan heads off and you can stick a fork in this one - it's as good as done
short and tucking up Ikram, who jabs it away to backward square leg
banged in, clips him on the top of the helmet! A final symbolic blow, England win by a massive 150-run margin - but Afghanistan are still standing
